alert.note: Alert for Greenville; Pickens (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 04 at 3:28PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Elevated stream levels and flows caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of upstate South Carolina, including the following counties, Greenville and Pickens. * WHEN...Until 530 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...River or stream levels are high and flows are elevated. Some rural or unpaved low water crossings may be under water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 328 PM EDT, Although heavy rainfall has ended for the time being, stream levels and flows will remain high along the South Saluda River, the Oolenoy River, and their tributaries through the remainder of the afternoon. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen since this morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Table Rock State Park, Caesars Head State Park, Jones Gap State Park, Jocassee Gorges, Pumpkintown, Cleveland, Rocky Bottom and Sunset. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
